WRITING.TITLE: Rubber hose animation?
WRITING.TEXT:
How to learn? Rubber hose animation, the 1920s style of american animation with arms and legs having no bones. Where would one find tutorials or explanations as to how to replicate such a style, more in depth the better.
Like this : http://www.cartoonbrew.com/wp-content/uploads/tumblr_m49kbhxesi1rouwdqo1_500.gif
Well toon boom Harmony is probably a safe bet,the film princess and the frog used that. Although Ive never used that program. :/
gave me a fright, bloody hell.

I kinda use abit of everything, I don't like to restrict my self to one program.
Flash, easy to use but usually 'cheap' looking, learning curve is pretty low too.
After effects, easy to use, bit of a steeper curve, although I only use it mostly for graphical or film fx.
Ms paint, easy to use, quick learning curve. (then throw all images in movie maker and adjust timing).
Photoshop, can seem overwhelming at first but once you know the basics and shortcuts (highly recommend learning those) it's good for short animations (gifs) but any thing over 150+ frames is stretching it (also depends on the style) like drawing each frame will leave you with heaps of frames or simply moving a object across is ok as only one layer.
Pivot, (use to use) great learning curve it was my first 'animation' program. Limited but also fun for awhile.
paper and pencil, most basic learning curve at the start, but takes a long time and space. expensive' too, paper, light box , peg bar, pens, camera or scanner. And this will test your patience to the limit.
ahem...."everything,by everyone"
